author: Randall Stross
title: Stargazers See a Business Plan
text:
Building rockets for single use is like building a Boeing 737 airliner, flying it once and then discarding it. Elon Musk, the founder of space startup SpaceX, drew the analogy when making the case for designing reusable rockets like his companyâ€™s Falcon 9. Slashing the cost of space travel depends on reuse of the hardware.
The insight has been grasped by others. Jeff Bezos has his own space startup, Blue Origin, which is building reusable rockets, and Richard Branson has Virgin Galactic, which is using space-plane technology...
